description.p: English is a member of the West Germanic group of the Germanic languages. It is an official language of almost 60 sovereign states and is now a global lingua franca_
It is the third-most-common native language in the world and it is widely learned as a second language_

L’anglais est une langue appartenant au groupe occidental des langues germaniques. C’est la langue officielle de près de 60 États souverains. De nos jours, l’anglais est une lingua franca mondiale (langue véhiculaire)_
L’anglais est la troisième langue maternelle la plus parlée dans le monde et la langue la plus étudiée comme deuxième langue_

Documentation for ISO 639 identifier "AAT": This individual language is member of a macrolanguage : Albanian (sqi)

source.description: Adamorobe Sign Language is a sign language used in Adamorobe village in Ghana. Sign languages are languages which mainly use signs made with the hands, the arms or the body and facial expressions_
Argentine Sign Language is a sign language used in Argentina. Sign languages are languages which mainly use signs made with the hands, the arms or the body and facial expressions_
Armenian Sign Language is a sign language used in Armenia. Sign languages are languages which mainly use signs made with the hands, the arms or the body and facial expressions_
Afghan Sign Language is a sign language used in Afghanistan. Sign languages are languages which mainly use signs made with the hands, the arms or the body and facial expressions_
Afrikaans is a West Germanic language. It is one of the official languages of South Africa_

comment.lg_version: Documentation for ISO 639 identifier "ALN": This individual language is member of a macrolanguage : Albanian (sqi)
Documentation for ISO 639 identifier "ALS": This individual language is member of a macrolanguage : Albanian (sqi)

source.description: Amharic is a Semitic language spoken in Ethiopia. The Amharic script is an abugida_

description.p: Arabic is a name for what are traditionally considered the descendants of the Classical Arabic language of the 6th century. This includes both the literary language and varieties of Arabic spoken in a wide arc of territory, stretching across the Middle East, North Africa, the Horn of Africa. Arabic belongs to the Semitic branch of the Afro-Asiatic family. The literary language is called Modern Standard Arabic or Literary Arabic, which is a pluricentric, fusional language. It is currently the only official form of Arabic, used in most written documents as well as in formal spoken occasions, such as lectures and news broadcasts_
Arabic is written using the Arabic script_

Parlée d’abord par les Arabes, cette langue sémitique qui se déploie géographiquement sur plusieurs continents s’étend sociologiquement à des peuples non arabes et est aujourd’hui la langue officielle de plusieurs organismes internationaux. L’arabe est aussi une des six langues officielles de l’Organisation des Nations unies_

La diglossie est un caractère de la langue arabe, qui permet de distinguer l’arabe vernaculaire de l’arabe littéraire. Le niveau de langue littéraire comprend l’arabe classique (pré-coranique, coranique et post-coranique) et l’arabe standard moderne. Le niveau de langue vernaculaire comprend toutes les variantes des dialectes arabes régionaux_
L’arabe utilise l’écriture arabe_

source.description: Araona is a Tacanan indigenous language. It is one of the official languages of Bolivia_

American Sign Language is a sign language used in the United States and most of anglophone Canada. Sign languages are languages which mainly use signs made with the hands, the arms or the body and facial expressions_
Australian Sign Language is a sign language used in Australia. Sign languages are languages which mainly use signs made with the hands, the arms or the body and facial expressions_
Algerian Sign Language is a sign language used in Algeria. Sign languages are languages which mainly use signs made with the hands, the arms or the body and facial expressions_
Austrian Sign Language is a sign language used in Austria. Sign languages are languages which mainly use signs made with the hands, the arms or the body and facial expressions_

Australian Aborigines Sign Language is a sign language used in Australia by aborigines communities. Sign languages are languages which mainly use signs made with the hands, the arms or the body and facial expressions_
Aymara is an Aymaran indigenous language. It is one of the official languages of Bolivia_
Ayoreo is a Zamucoan indigenous language. It is one of the official languages of Bolivia_

description.p: Azerbaijani or Azeri is a member of the Oghuz group of Turkic languages, spoken primarily in the Caucasus region. Azerbaijani and Turkish closely resemble each other_
Azeri was written in the Arabic-Persian script, a modified Latin script and with a form of the Cyrillic alphabet. After the collapse of the Soviet Union the Latin writing was introduced_
L’azéri ou azerbaïdjanais est une langue appartenant au groupe oghuz des langues turques, parlée principalement dans la région du Caucase. L’azéri et le turc sont assez similaires_
L’azéri a été écrit dans l’alphabet arabo-persan, un alphabet latin modifié et avec une forme de l’alphabet cyrillique. Après la chute de l’Union soviétique, l’écriture latine est introduite_
Belarusian is one of the East Slavic languages and shares many grammatical and lexical features with other members of the branch, Russian and Ukrainian. It is spoken mainly in Belarus_
Belorusian is written with the Cyrillic alphabet_

Le biélorusse fait partie de la famille des langues slaves et partage de nombreuses caractéristiques grammaticales et lexicales avec d’autres langues de cette famille, le russe et l’ukrainien. Il est parlé principalement en Biélorussie_
Le biélorusse s’écrit avec l’alphabet cyrillique_

Bengali is the language native to the region of Bengal, which comprises present-day Bangladesh and some east-north Indian states. It is written using the Bengali script. Bengali presents a strong case of diglossia, with the literary and standard form differing greatly from the colloquial speech of the regions_

On 21 February 1952 several students and political activists were killed during protests. The day was proclaimed the International Mother Language Day by Unesco in 1999 making the Bengali language the only language in the world to be also known for its language movements and people sacrificing their life for their mother language, Bengali_

Le bengali ou bangla est une langue indo-iranienne (sous-branche indo-aryenne) de la famille des langues indo-européennes. Originaire de la région du Bengale à l’est du sous-continent indien, le bengali est la langue nationale du Bangladesh et la langue officielle dans certains États indiens. Le bengali, par sa grande diversité de variantes régionales, forme un continuum linguistique_

Le 21 février 1952, plusieurs personnes furent tuées lors de manifestations pour le bengali. Pour cette raison, en 1999, l’Unesco a décidé de commémorer tous les 21 février comme la Journée internationale de la langue maternelle_

source.description: British Sign Language is a sign language used in the United Kingdom. Sign languages are languages which mainly use signs made with the hands, the arms or the body and facial expressions_
Ban Khor Sign Language is a sign language used in Ban Khor village in Thailand. Sign languages are languages which mainly use signs made with the hands, the arms or the body and facial expressions_

label.lg_version: langue des signes de Ban Khor

source.description: Bislama is an English-based creole language. It is one of the official languages of Vanuatu_

description.p: The Tibetic or Tibetan languages (Bodish) are a cluster of mutually unintelligible Tibeto-Burman languages spoken primarily by Tibetan peoples who live across a wide area of eastern Central Asia bordering the Indian subcontinent, including the Tibetan Plateau and the northern Indian subcontinent in Baltistan, Ladakh, Nepal, Sikkim, and Bhutan. The classical written form is a major regional literary language, particularly for its use in Buddhist literature_

Most Tibetic languages are written in an Indic script, with a historically conservative orthography (see below) that helps unify the Tibetan-language area. However, some Ladakhi and Balti speakers write with the Urdu script_

Le tibétain est une langue parlée par plusieurs millions de locuteurs dans l’ancien Tibet, c’est-à-dire la Région autonome du Tibet, les zones à population tibétaine du Qinghai (Amdo), du Gansu, du Sichuan et du Yunnan (Kham) en République populaire de Chine, et dans certaines régions des pays environnants, de l’Himalaya et de l’Asie centrale, comme le Ladakh et le Sikkim en Inde, le Baltistan pakistanais, le Bhoutan et le nord du Népal. Le tibétain est une langue appartenant à la famille des langues tibéto-birmanes. Il se subdivise en un grand nombre de dialectes_
L’écriture Phagspa, alphasyllabaire, fut créée comme écriture unifiée pour toutes les langues de l’Empire mongol. Le lama Phagspa la dériva de son écriture natale, l’écriture tibétaine_

source.description: Bamako Sign Language is a sign language used in Bamako region in Mali. Sign languages are languages which mainly use signs made with the hands, the arms or the body and facial expressions_

description.p: Bosnian is a South Slavic language, the standardised variety of the ‘Serbo-Croatian’ used by Bosniaks, based on the Shtokavian dialect_
Bosnian is written in both the Latin and the Cyrillic alphabet_

Le bosnien, parfois appelé «bosniaque», est une langue indo-européenne de la branche des langues slaves, groupe méridional de ces langues; il a pour base le dialecte chtokavien de l’entité linguistique appelée «langue serbo-croate»_
Le bosnien est écrit avec l’alphabet latin mais aussi avec l’alphabet cyrillique_

source.description: Bulgarian Sign Language is a sign language used in Bulgaria. Sign languages are languages which mainly use signs made with the hands, the arms or the body and facial expressions_

Bengkala Sign Language is a sign language used in Bengkala and Kata Kolok villages in Bali. Sign languages are languages which mainly use signs made with the hands, the arms or the body and facial expressions_

description.p: Breton is a member of the Brittonic subgroup of the Celtic languages, spoken in Brittany, in western France. It is most closely related to Cornish_
Breton is classified as ‘severely endangered’ by the Unesco Atlas of the World’s Languages in Danger_
Le breton est une langue du sous-groupe brittonique des langues celtiques, parlée en Bretagne, dans l’ouest de la France. Il est très proche du cornique_
Le breton est reconnu comme langue régionale ou minoritaire de France et comme langue de la région de la Bretagne. Il est classé comme «langue sérieusement en danger» selon l’Unesco_

source.description: Baure is an Arawakan indigenous language. It is one of the official languages of Bolivia_

description.p: Bulgarian is a member of the Southern subgroup of the Slavic languages, spoken mainly in Bulgaria_
Modern Bulgarian has several striking differences from other Slavic languages. e.g. nouns are no longer declined; however, there is a definite article suffixed to the noun_
Bulgarian is written with the Cyrillic alphabet_
Le bulgare est une langue du sous-groupe sud des langues slaves. Il est parlé principalement en Bulgarie_
Le bulgare a plusieurs caractéristiques qui le distinguent de toutes les autres langues slaves, par exemple l’absence de déclinaison ou l’existence d’un article défini suffixé au nom_
Il est écrit avec l’alphabet cyrillique_

source.description: Bolivian Sign Language is a sign language used in Bolivia. Sign languages are languages which mainly use signs made with the hands, the arms or the body and facial expressions_
Brazilian Sign Language is a sign language used in Brazil. Sign languages are languages which mainly use signs made with the hands, the arms or the body and facial expressions_
Carolinian is a Malayo-Polynesian language. It is one of the official languages of the Northern Mariana Islands_
Chacobo is a Tacanan indigenous language. It is one of the official languages of Bolivia_
Chimane is a Moseten indigenous language. It is one of the official languages of Bolivia_

Catalan is a member of the Romance family of languages. It is spoken in Catalonia, north-eastern Spain and adjoining parts of France and it is the official language of Andorra. Catalan has a co-official status in the Spanish autonomous communities of Catalonia, the Balearic Islands, and the Valencian Community (where the language is known as Valencian). It is also the language of the city of Alghero on the Italian island Sardinia_

Le catalan est une langue latine. Il est parlé en Catalogne, en Espagne du Nord et dans des parties adjacentes de la France, et est la langue officielle de l’Andorre. Le catalan a un statut coofficiel dans les communautés autonomes espagnoles de Catalogne, les îles Baléares et la Communauté de Valence (où la langue est connue sous le nom de «valencien»). Il est aussi la langue de la ville d’Alghero sur l’île italienne de Sardaigne_
Cavineña is a Tacanan indigenous language. It is one of the official languages of Bolivia_
Kallawaya is a Quechuan indigenous language. It is one of the official languages of Bolivia_
Chiquitano is an indigenous language isolate. It is one of the official languages of Bolivia_
Canichana is an indigenous language isolate. It is one of the official languages of Bolivia_
Chadian Sign Language is a sign language used in Chad. Sign languages are languages which mainly use signs made with the hands, the arms or the body and facial expressions_

description.p: Czech is a member of the Western subgroup of the Slavic languages, spoken mainly in the Czech Republic_
Czech is a fusional language and one of the most highly inflected tongues in the world_
Le tchèque est une langue du sous-groupe occidental des langues slaves, parlée principalement en République tchèque_
Le tchèque est une des langues les plus flexionnelles dans le monde_

source.description: Chamorro is a Malayo-Polynesian language. It is one of the official languages of Guam and the Northern Mariana Islands_

Central Kurdish (Sorani) is a Kurdish dialect spoken in Iraq, mainly in Iraqi Kurdistan, as well as the Kurdistan Province of western Iran. The language is written in an adapted form of the Kurdo-Arabic alphabet_

Mandarin is a group of related varieties of Chinese spoken across most of northern and southwestern China. When the Mandarin group is taken as one language, as is often done in academic literature, it has more native speakers (nearly a billion) than any other language_

Le mandarin, est une catégorie des langues chinoises parlée dans le nord et le sud-ouest de la Chine continentale. Envisagée comme une langue, c'est celle qui compte le plus grand nombre de locuteurs dans le monde_

description.p: Cornish is a south-western Brittonic Celtic language spoken in Cornwall_
Since 2000 the language has undergone a revival. It is a recognised regional language of the United Kingdom, protected under the European Charter for Regional or Minority Languages_
Le cornique est une langue celtique insulaire du groupe brittonique, parlée en Cornouailles (au Royaume-Uni)_
Il est reconnu par le Royaume-Uni comme langue régionale de l’Écosse, selon la charte européenne des langues régionales ou minoritaires_

source.description: Corsican is an Italo-Dalmatian Romance language, a member of the South Central group of the dialects of Italy, spoken and written on the islands of Corsica (France) and northern Sardinia (Italy). Unesco classifies Corsican as a definitely endangered language_

description.p: Le corse est une langue italo-dalmate romane, membre du groupe centre-sud des dialectes de l’Italie, parlée et écrite sur l’île de Corse (France) et au nord de la Sardaigne (Italie)_
L’Unesco classe le corse comme une langue définitivement en voie de disparition_

source.description: Seselwa Creole French is a French-based creol language. It is one of the official languages of the Seychelles_

Catalan Sign Language is a sign language used in Catalonia and Valencia communities in Spain. Sign languages are languages which mainly use signs made with the hands, the arms or the body and facial expressions_
Chiangmai Sign Language is a sign language used in Chiang Mai city in Thailand. Sign languages are languages which mainly use signs made with the hands, the arms or the body and facial expressions_
Czech Sign Language is a sign language used in the Czech Republic. Sign languages are languages which mainly use signs made with the hands, the arms or the body and facial expressions_
Cuba Sign Language is a sign language used in Cuba. Sign languages are languages which mainly use signs made with the hands, the arms or the body and facial expressions_
Chilean Sign Language is a sign language used in Chile. Sign languages are languages which mainly use signs made with the hands, the arms or the body and facial expressions_
Chinese Sign Language is a sign language used in China. Sign languages are languages which mainly use signs made with the hands, the arms or the body and facial expressions_
Colombian Sign Language is a sign language used in Colombia. Sign languages are languages which mainly use signs made with the hands, the arms or the body and facial expressions_
Croatia Sign Language is a sign language used in Croatia. Sign languages are languages which mainly use signs made with the hands, the arms or the body and facial expressions_
Costa Rican Sign Language is a sign language used in Costa Rica. Sign languages are languages which mainly use signs made with the hands, the arms or the body and facial expressions_
Cayubaba is an indigenous language isolate. It is one of the official languages of Bolivia_

description.p: Welsh (Cymraeg) is a member of the Brittonic subgroup of the Celtic languages. It has the status of official language in Wales_
Modern standard literary Welsh is a conservative form of the language: this makes it more difficult to learn but those who can read it can also read the early classics_
Le gallois est une langue du sous-groupe brittonique des langues celtiques, parlée principalement au pays de Galles. Il a le statut de langue officielle au pays de Galles_
Le gallois littéraire moderne standard est une forme conservatrice de la langue: cela le rend plus difficile à apprendre, mais ceux qui savent le lire peuvent également lire les premiers classiques_
Danish is a North Germanic language spoken principally in Denmark and as a second language in the Faroe Islands and Greenland. Danish is largely mutually intelligible with Norwegian and Swedish_
Danish has a relatively large vowel inventory and is distinguished by the many pharyngealised sounds_

Le danois est une langue germanique du Nord, parlée principalement au Danemark, et est la deuxième langue dans les Îles Féroé et au Groenland. Le danois est en grande partie mutuellement intelligible avec le norvégien et le suédois_
Il possède un inventaire de voyelles relativement vaste et se distingue par ses nombreux sons pharyngalisés_

source.description: German is a West Germanic language, most closely related to Dutch and Yiddish. German is a pluricentric language, with multiple countries having their own standardised variants as well as many dialects. There is also one variant referred to as Standard German_

L’allemand est une langue germanique occidentale, proche du néerlandais et du yiddish. L’allemand est une langue pluricentrique, avec plusieurs pays ayant leurs propres variantes normalisées ainsi que de nombreux dialectes. Il existe aussi une variante dénommée «allemand standard»_

description.p: Dhivehi or Maldivian is an Indo-Aryan language predominantly spoken in the Maldives, where it is the national language. Maldivian is a descendent of Maharashtri Prakrit and is closely related to Marathi, Konkani and Sinhalese languages, but not mutually intelligible with them_
Maldivian is written in the Thaana script_
Le divehi ou maldivien est une langue indo-aryenne parlée principalement aux Maldives, où elle est la langue officielle_
L’alphabet utilisé est le thâna ou thaana, qui est dérivé de l’arabe_

source.description: Dominican Sign Language is a sign language used in Dominican Republic. Sign languages are languages which mainly use signs made with the hands, the arms or the body and facial expressions_
Dutch Sign Language is a sign language used in Netherlands. Sign languages are languages which mainly use signs made with the hands, the arms or the body and facial expressions_
Danish Sign Language is a sign language used in Denmark. Sign languages are languages which mainly use signs made with the hands, the arms or the body and facial expressions_
Dzongkha is a Sino-Tibetan language. It is the official language of Bhutan_
Ecuadorian Sign Language is a sign language used in Ecuador. Sign languages are languages which mainly use signs made with the hands, the arms or the body and facial expressions_

comment.lg_version: Documentation for ISO 639 identifier "EKK": This individual language is member of a macrolanguage : Estonian (est)

description.p: Greek is an independent branch of the Indo-European family of languages, native to the southern Balkans, the Aegean Islands, western Asia Minor and Cyprus. It has the longest continuous recorded history of any European language_
Its writing system has been the Greek alphabet for the majority of its history_
Greek roots are often used to coin new words for other languages; Greek and Latin are the predominant sources of international scientific vocabulary_

Le grec fait partie de la branche indépendante de la famille indo-européenne des langues, principalement parlé dans le sud des Balkans, sur les îles de la mer Égée, en Asie Mineure occidentale et à Chypre. Il a la plus longue histoire enregistrée en continu de toutes les langues européennes_
Son système d’écriture a été l’alphabet grec pour la majorité de son histoire_
Les racines grecques sont souvent utilisées pour créer de nouveaux mots dans d’autres langues; le grec et le latin sont les principales sources de vocabulaire scientifique international_

Esperanto is the most widely spoken constructed international auxiliary language. Its name derives from Doktoro Esperanto (‘Esperanto’ translates as ‘one who hopes’), the pseudonym under which Ludwig Zamenhof published the first book detailing Esperanto, in 1887_
This artificial language is Indo-European based, both in its lexicon and in the grammatical categories with which it operates_

L’espéranto est la langue auxiliaire construite internationale la plus parlée. Son nom dérive de «Doktoro Esperanto» («espéranto» se traduit par «celui qui espère»), le pseudonyme sous lequel Ludwig Zamenhof a publié le premier livre détaillant l’espéranto, en 1887_
Cette langue artificielle a des bases indo-européennes, à la fois dans son lexique et dans les catégories grammaticales avec lesquels elle opère_

source.description: Ese Ejja is a Tacanan indigenous language. It is one of the official languages of Bolivia_
Egypt Sign Language is a sign language used in Egypt. Sign languages are languages which mainly use signs made with the hands, the arms or the body and facial expressions_
Salvadoran Sign Language is a sign language used in El Salvador. Sign languages are languages which mainly use signs made with the hands, the arms or the body and facial expressions_
Estonian Sign Language is a sign language used in Estonia. Sign languages are languages which mainly use signs made with the hands, the arms or the body and facial expressions_

description.p: Estonian belongs (with Finnish) to the Baltic-Finnic subgroup of the Finno-Ugrian languages from the Uralic family. It is the official language of Estonia_
Estonian represents a transitional form from an agglutinating language to a fusional language_
L’estonien appartient, avec le finnois, au sous-groupe balto-finnois des langues finno-ougriennes de la famille ouralienne. Il est la langue officielle de l’Estonie_
L’estonien représente une forme de transition d’une langue agglutinante à une langue fusionnelle_

source.description: Ethiopian Sign Language is a sign language used in Ethiopia. Sign languages are languages which mainly use signs made with the hands, the arms or the body and facial expressions_

Basque (euskara) is a non Indo-European language of uncertain origin; the only living language of Europe that has no known linguistic relatives. It is spoken by the Basque people, indigenous to and mainly inhabiting the Basque Country, a region spanning an area in north-eastern Spain and south-western France_

Le basque (euskara) est une langue non indo-européenne d’origine incertaine et la seule langue vivante de l’Europe qui n’a pas de parents linguistiques connus. Il s’agit de la langue parlée par le peuple basque, qui est indigène et habite principalement au Pays basque, région couvrant une zone dans le nord-ouest de l’Espagne et le sud-ouest de la France_
Ewe belongs to the Gbe branch of the Niger–Congo language family. It is spoken in southeastern Ghana_

description.p: Faroese is a North Germanic language spoken in the Faroe Islands_
Faroese grammar is related and very similar to that of modern Icelandic and Old Norse_
Le féroïen ou féringien est une langue germanique du Nord parlée dans les Îles Féroé_
La grammaire des Îles Féroé est très proche de celles de l’islandais moderne et du vieux norrois_

Persian is an Iranian language within the Indo-Iranian branch of the Indo-European languages and the only South-Western Iranian language. It is primarily spoken in Iran (Persia), and as a different dialect in Afghanistan (officially known as Dari since 1958 for political reasons), and Tajikistan (officially known as Tajiki Persian since the Soviet era for political reasons), and some other regions. Persian is a pluricentric language and its grammar is similar to that of many contemporary European languages_
Modern Iranian Persian and Afghan Persian are written using a modified variant of the Arabic alphabet. Tajik Persian is typically written in a modified version of the Cyrillic alphabet_

Le persan est la langue parlée en Iran (Perse), en Afghanistan et au Tadjikistan en tant que langue officielle, ainsi qu’au Bahreïn (minorité iranophone) et en Ouzbékistan (minorité tadjike). Il appartient au groupe indo-iranien de la famille des langues indo-européennes_

De nos jours, les langues persanes s’écrivent surtout au moyen de l’alphabet arabo-persan, variante de l’alphabet arabe. Au Tadjikistan et en Ouzbékistan, la langue tadjike s’écrit en caractères cyrilliques_

source.description: Quebec Sign Language is a sign language used in francophone Canada. Sign languages are languages which mainly use signs made with the hands, the arms or the body and facial expressions_
Fijian is a Malayo-Polynesian language. It is one of the official languages of Fiji_
Filipino is a Malayo-Polynesian language. It is one of the official languages of the Philippines_

description.p: Finnish belongs (with Estonian) to the Baltic-Finnic subgroup of the Finno-Ugrian languages from the Uralic family. Finnish is one of two official languages of Finland (the other being Swedish)_
Finnish is typologically between fusional and agglutinative languages_

Le finnois appartient, avec l’estonien, au sous-groupe balto-finnois des langues finno-ougriennes de la famille ouralienne. Le finnois est l’une des deux langues officielles de la Finlande (l’autre étant le suédois)_
Typologiquement, le finnois se situe entre les langues fusionnelles et agglutinantes_

source.description: French is the most northerly of the Romance languages and is an official language in 29 countries. It is an official language of all United Nations agencies and of a large number of international organisations. Outside of France, the highest numbers of French speakers are found in Canada, Belgium, Switzerland and Luxembourg_

Le français est la plus septentrionale des langues romanes et est une langue officielle dans 29 pays. Il est aussi une langue officielle de tous les organismes des Nations unies et d’un grand nombre d’organisations internationales. Hors de France, le plus grand nombre de francophones se trouvent au Canada, en Belgique, en Suisse et au Luxembourg_

description.p: Frisian belongs, together with English, to the North Sea subgroup of the West Germanic languages. It is spoken by Frisian ethnic groups, who live mainly in the northern part of the Netherlands_
There are three varieties of Frisian: West Frisian, Saterland Frisian, and North Frisian_

Le frison appartient, avec l’anglais, au sous-groupe de la mer du Nord des langues germaniques de l’Ouest. Il est parlé par des groupes ethniques de la Frise, qui vivent principalement dans la partie nord des Pays-Bas_
Il est réparti en trois variantes: le frison occidental, le frison oriental et le frison septentrional_

source.description: Finnish Sign Language is a sign language used in Finland. Sign languages are languages which mainly use signs made with the hands, the arms or the body and facial expressions_

French Sign Language is a sign language used in France and French-speaking parts of Switzerland. Sign languages are languages which mainly use signs made with the hands, the arms or the body and facial expressions_

Finland-Swedish Sign Language is a sign language used in Swedish community in Finland. Sign languages are languages which mainly use signs made with the hands, the arms or the body and facial expressions_

description.p: Scottish Gaelic, sometimes also called Gaelic, is a Celtic language native to Scotland_
Gaelic is an official language in Scotland and it is a recognised minority language of the United Kingdom, protected under the European Charter for Regional or Minority Languages_
Le gaélique écossais ou écossais est une langue celtique parlée en Écosse_
Le gaélique écossais est reconnu par le Royaume-Uni comme langue régionale de l’Écosse, selon la charte européenne des langues régionales ou minoritaires_
Irish, Irish Gaelic, or Gaelic (Gaeilge) belongs to the Gaelic branch of the Celtic family of languages, originating in Ireland and historically spoken by the Irish people_

Irish is spoken as a first language by a small minority of Irish people, and as a second language by a rather larger group. Irish enjoys constitutional status as the national and first official language of the Republic of Ireland, and is an officially recognised minority language in Northern Ireland_
L’irlandais, gaélique irlandais ou gaélique (Gaeilge) appartient à la branche gaélique de la famille des langues celtiques, originaires de l’Irlande et historiquement parlées par le peuple irlandais_

L’irlandais est utilisé comme première langue par une minorité irlandaise et comme deuxième langue par un groupe beaucoup plus large. L’irlandais bénéficie d’un statut constitutionnel comme langue officielle nationale et première langue de la République d’Irlande, et est une langue minoritaire officiellement reconnue en Irlande du Nord_

source.description: Galician (galego) is an Indo-European language of the Western Ibero-Romance branch, closely related to Portuguese. It is spoken mainly in the autonomous region of Galicia, located in north-western Spain_

Le galicien (galego) est une langue indo-européenne de la branche ibéro-romane occidentale, très proche du portugais. Il est principalement parlé dans la région autonome de Galice, située dans le nord-ouest de l’Espagne_
Manx is a Celtic language. It is one of the official languages of the Isle of Man_
Guarani is a Tupian indigenous language. It is one of the official languages of Bolivia and Paraguay_
Ghanaian Sign Language is a sign language used in Ghana. Sign languages are languages which mainly use signs made with the hands, the arms or the body and facial expressions_

German Sign Language is a sign language used in German and in the German-speaking community of Belgium. Sign languages are languages which mainly use signs made with the hands, the arms or the body and facial expressions_
Guatemalan Sign Language is a sign language used in Guatemala. Sign languages are languages which mainly use signs made with the hands, the arms or the body and facial expressions_
Greek Sign Language is a sign language used in Greece. Sign languages are languages which mainly use signs made with the hands, the arms or the body and facial expressions_
Guarani is a Tupian indigenous language. It is one of the official languages of Paraguay_
Guinean Sign Language is a sign language used in Guinea. Sign languages are languages which mainly use signs made with the hands, the arms or the body and facial expressions_
Guarayu is a Tupian indigenous language. It is one of the official languages of Bolivia_
Hanoi Sign Language is a sign language used in Hanoi city in Vietnam. Sign languages are languages which mainly use signs made with the hands, the arms or the body and facial expressions_
Haiphong Sign Language is a sign language used in Haiphong city in Vietnam. Sign languages are languages which mainly use signs made with the hands, the arms or the body and facial expressions_
Haitian is a French-based creole language. It is one of the official languages of Haiti_

description.p: Serbo-Croatian, also called Serbo-Croat, Serbo-Croat-Bosnian (SCB), or Bosnian-Croatian-Serbian (BCS), is a South Slavic language and the primary language of Serbia, Croatia, Bosnia and Herzegovina, and Montenegro. It is a pluricentric language with four mutually intelligible standard varieties. The term Serbo-Croatian was widely used in former Yougoslavia_
To write Serbo-Croatian, Cyrillic and Latin scripts were equally used and easily interchangeable_

Le serbo-croate, aussi appelé «serbo-croate-bosniaque» (SCB) ou «bosniaque-croate-serbe» (BCS), est une langue slave du Sud et la principale langue de la Serbie, de la Croatie, de la Bosnie-Herzégovine et du Monténégro. C’est une langue pluricentrique avec quatre variantes standards mutuellement intelligibles. Le terme «serbo-croate» a été largement utilisé dans l’ex-Yougoslavie_
Pour écrire en serbo-croate, les alphabets latin et cyrillique sont indifféremment utilisés et facilement interchangeables_

source.description: Andaman Creole Hindi is a trade language of the Andaman Islands, spoken as a native language especially in Port Blair and villages to the south. It is described as a creolization of Hindustani, Bengali, and Malayalam_

label.lg_version: κρεολική της χιντι των νησιών Άνταμαν

source.description: Honduras Sign Language is a sign language used in Honduras. Sign languages are languages which mainly use signs made with the hands, the arms or the body and facial expressions_

description.p: Hebrew is a North-Western Semitic language of the Afroasiatic language family, employed since biblical times by Jews. It was revived as a spoken and literary language in the 19th century. Modern Hebrew is one of the two official languages of Israel (the other being Arabic), while Classical Hebrew is used for prayer or study in Jewish communities around the world today_
Hebrew has always employed a Hebrew script_

L’hébreu est une langue sémitique du Nord-Ouest de la famille des langues afro-asiatiques, utilisée depuis les temps bibliques par les Juifs. Il a été relancé en tant que langue parlée et littéraire au XIXe siècle. L’hébreu moderne est une des deux langues officielles d’Israël (l’autre étant l’arabe), tandis que l’hébreu classique est utilisé pour la prière ou l’étude au sein des communautés juives dans le monde d’aujourd’hui_
L’hébreu a toujours utilisé un alphabet hébreu_

source.description: Fiji Hindi is an Indo-Aryan language. It is one of the official languages of Fiji. Fiji Hindi is written using both the Latin and Devanagari script_

description.p: Hindi, or more precisely Modern Standard Hindi, is a standardised and Sanskritised register of the Hindustani language. Modern Standard Hindi is one of the official languages of India. Hindi is the fourth-most-widely spoken language in the world, but this includes not only Hindu speakers of Hindustani, but also people who identify as native speakers of related languages who consider their speech to be a dialect of Hindi, the Hindi belt_
Hindi is written in Devanagari script_

source.description: Le hindi est la plus parlée des langues de l’Inde. Utilisée essentiellement dans le nord et le centre de l’Inde, c’est une langue indo-européenne de la branche des langues indo-aryennes, qui en est la plus vaste famille, dérivée du sanskrit et de divers prâkrits, écrite la plupart du temps au moyen de l’alphasyllabaire devanāgarī, qui se lit et s’écrit de gauche à droite. L’ourdou est le nom pakistanais du hindi. Le hindi et l’ourdou sont parfaitement intercompréhensibles et, avant la partition de 1947 entre l’Inde et le Pakistan, constituaient une seule et même langue, appelée «hindoustani»_
Hong Kong Sign Language is a sign language used in Hong Kong. Sign languages are languages which mainly use signs made with the hands, the arms or the body and facial expressions_
Hiri Motu is a simplified version of the Austronesian language Motu. It is one of the official languages of Papua New Guinea_

original_name.lg_version: Ho Chi Minh City Sign Language

source.description: Ho Chi Minh City Sign Language is a sign language used in Ho Chi Minh City in Vietnam. Sign languages are languages which mainly use signs made with the hands, the arms or the body and facial expressions_

label.lg_version: Ho Chi Minh City Sign Language
język migowy miasta Ho Chi Minh

source.description: Hawai'i Pidgin Sign Language is an indigenous sign language used in Hawaii. Sign languages are languages which mainly use signs made with the hands, the arms or the body and facial expressions_

description.p: Croatian is the standardised variety of the Serbo-Croatian language used by Croats, principally in Croatia and in Bosnia and Herzegovina. Standard Croatian is based on the Shtokavian dialect of Serbo-Croatian_
Croatian uses exclusively the Latin alphabet_

Le croate est la variante standard de la langue serbo-croate utilisée par les Croates, principalement en Croatie et en Bosnie-Herzégovine. Sa norme est basée sur le dialecte chtokavien du serbo-croate_
Le croate utilise exclusivement l’alphabet latin_

source.description: Upper Sorbian is a minority language spoken by Sorbs in Germany in the historical province of Upper Lusatia, which is today part of Saxony. It is grouped in the West Slavic language branch_
Le haut-sorabe est une langue parlée en Allemagne, dans la province historique de Lusace, aujourd'hui en Saxe. Il appartient à la famille occidentale des langues slaves_
Hungarian Sign Language is a sign language used in Hungary. Sign languages are languages which mainly use signs made with the hands, the arms or the body and facial expressions_
Hausa Sign Language is a sign language used in Kano city in Nigeria. Sign languages are languages which mainly use signs made with the hands, the arms or the body and facial expressions_

description.p: Hungarian (Magyar), like Finnish and Estonian, belongs to the Finno-Ugric branch of the Uralic language family. It is the official language of Hungary and is also spoken by communities of Hungarian people in neighbouring countries_
In Hungarian, surnames precede Christian names_

Le hongrois (magyar), comme l’estonien et le finnois, appartient à la branche finno-ougrienne de la famille des langues ouraliennes. Il est la langue officielle de la Hongrie et est également parlé par les communautés hongroises dans les pays voisins_
En hongrois, les noms de famille précèdent les prénoms_

The Armenian language (hayeren) forms an independent branch of the Indo-European family. It is spoken in the Republic of Armenia (where it is the official language), in Nagorno-Karabakh, in north-western Iran and in the Armenian diaspora_
Armenian has its own unique script, the Armenian alphabet, invented by Mesrop Mashtots in the 5th century AD_

L’arménien (hayeren) constitue une branche indépendante de la famille indo-européenne. Il est parlé dans la République d’Arménie (où il est la langue officielle), dans le Haut-Karabakh, dans le nord-ouest de l’Iran et dans la diaspora arménienne_
L’arménien a son propre système d’écriture unique, l’alphabet arménien, inventé par Mesrop Maštoc’ au Ve siècle_

source.description: Icelandic Sign Language is a sign language used in Iceland. Sign languages are languages which mainly use signs made with the hands, the arms or the body and facial expressions_
Ignaciano is an Arawakan indigenous language. It is one of the official languages of Bolivia_

Interlingua is an international auxiliary language (IAL), a modern version of Latin, developed between 1937 and 1951 by the International Auxiliary Language Association. It ranks among the top three most widely used IALs (after Esperanto and perhaps Ido), and is the most widely used naturalistic IAL: in other words, its vocabulary, grammar and other characteristics are derived from natural languages. Interlingua was developed to combine a simple, mostly regular grammar with a vocabulary common to the widest possible range of languages, making it unusually easy to learn. Conversely, it is used as a rapid introduction to many natural languages. Interlingua literature maintains that (written) Interlingua is comprehensible to the hundreds of millions of people who speak a Romance language_

L’interlingua désigne aujourd’hui la langue construite élaborée par l’International Auxiliary Language Association (IALA). La construction de l’interlingua par l’IALA fut achevée en 1951. Le vocabulaire de l’interlingua est emprunté essentiellement aux langues romanes ainsi qu’à l’anglais du fait qu’une grande partie de son vocabulaire est d’origine romane. La grammaire est également inspirée de ces langues, mais avec des simplifications. Il existe aujourd’hui une Union mondiale pour l’interlingua (Union Mundial pro Interlingua), qui compte des adhérents dans le monde entier. On trouve aussi une abondante littérature en interlingua, ainsi que des sites internet et des revues_

Indonesian is the official language of Indonesia. It is a standardised register of Malay, an Austronesian language which has been used as a lingua franca in the Indonesian archipelago for centuries. Most Indonesians also speak one of more than 700 indigenous languages. Most formal education, and nearly all national media and other forms of communication, are conducted in Indonesian. The Indonesian name for the language is Bahasa Indonesia (literally ‘the language of Indonesia’)_

L’indonésien (bahasa Indonesia, littéralement «langue de l’Indonésie») est la langue officielle de la République d’Indonésie. C’est aussi l’une des langues d’usage dans la République démocratique du Timor-Oriental. L’indonésien est l’une des formes du malais (bahasa Melayu). Pour une majorité d’Indonésiens, ce n’est pas leur langue maternelle. Ils ne l’apprennent à l’école que vers l’âge de 5 ans_
Indonesian Sign Language is a sign language used in Indonesia. Sign languages are languages which mainly use signs made with the hands, the arms or the body and facial expressions_
Indian Sign Language is a sign language used in India. Sign languages are languages which mainly use signs made with the hands, the arms or the body and facial expressions_
Italian Sign Language is a sign language used in Italia. Sign languages are languages which mainly use signs made with the hands, the arms or the body and facial expressions_
Irish Sign Language is a sign language used in Ireland and in Northern Ireland. Sign languages are languages which mainly use signs made with the hands, the arms or the body and facial expressions_

Icelandic is an Indo-European language belonging to the North Germanic or Nordic branch of the Germanic languages. The vast majority of Icelandic speakers live in Iceland. Most Icelanders do not have surnames but patronymics. Forenames are followed by the genitive form of the father’s (or the mother’s) Christian name completed by son (son of …) or dóttir (daughter of …), e.g. Jónsson, Jónsdóttir if the name of the father is Jón_

L’islandais est une langue indo-européenne appartenant à la branche nord germanique des langues germaniques. La grande majorité des locuteurs islandais vivent en Islande. La plupart des Islandais n’ont pas de noms de famille mais des patronymes. Les prénoms sont suivis par la forme au génitif du prénom du père (ou de la mère), complétée par «son» (fils de …) ou «dóttir» (fille de …), par exemple les enfants de Jón s’appellent ainsi Jónsson et Jónsdóttir_
Israeli Sign Language is a sign language used in Israel. Sign languages are languages which mainly use signs made with the hands, the arms or the body and facial expressions_

description.p: Italian is a member of the Romance language group, spoken mainly in south Europe. Among the Romance languages, Italian is the closest to Latin in terms of vocabulary. The Italian language adopted by the state after the unification of Italy is based on Tuscan_
Many Italian speakers are native bilinguals of both standardised Italian and other regional variants_

L’italien est une langue appartenant au groupe des langues romanes, parlée principalement en Europe du Sud. Parmi les langues romanes, l’italien est très proche du latin en termes de vocabulaire. La langue italienne adoptée par l’État après l’unification de l’Italie est fondée sur le dialecte de la Toscane_
De nombreux locuteurs italiens sont bilingues et parlent aussi bien l’italien standard que les autres variantes régionales_

source.description: Itene is a Chapacuran indigenous language. It is one of the official languages of Bolivia_
Itonama is an indigenous language isolate. It is one of the official languages of Bolivia_
Jamaican Country Sign Language is a sign language used in a village in Jamaica. Sign languages are languages which mainly use signs made with the hands, the arms or the body and facial expressions_
Jhankot Sign Language is a sign language used in Jhankot village in Nepal. Sign languages are languages which mainly use signs made with the hands, the arms or the body and facial expressions_
Jordanian Sign Language is a sign language used in Jordania. Sign languages are languages which mainly use signs made with the hands, the arms or the body and facial expressions_

Japanese is an East Asian language spoken primarily in Japan. It is a member of the Japonic (or Japanese-Ryukyuan) language family, whose relation to other language groups is debated. Japanese has no genetic relationship with Chinese, but it makes extensive use of Chinese characters, or kanji, in its writing system, and a large portion of its vocabulary is borrowed from Chinese. Along with kanji, the Japanese writing system primarily uses two syllabic (or moraic) scripts, hiragana and katakana. Latin script is used in a limited way, such as for imported acronyms, and the numeral system uses mostly Arabic numerals, alongside traditional Chinese numerals_

Le japonais est la langue du Japon, parlée par le peuple japonais. Le japonais appartient à la famille isolée des langues japoniques. La langue japonaise utilise conjointement deux ensembles de caractères distincts: les kanjis, écriture logographique d’origine chinoise, et les kanas, système moraïque dérivé des kanjis. Les kanas se divisent eux-mêmes en deux groupes, les hiraganas et les katakanas. Les katakanas sont employés pour l’écriture de mots d’origine étrangère au Japon, et les hiraganas, pour noter la plupart des mots et affixes grammaticaux_
Japanese Sign Language is a sign language used in Japan. Sign languages are languages which mainly use signs made with the hands, the arms or the body and facial expressions_
Jumla Sign Language is a sign language used in Jumla village in Nepal. Sign languages are languages which mainly use signs made with the hands, the arms or the body and facial expressions_

description.p: Greenlandic (Kalaallisut) is an Eskimo-Aleut language spoken by a small group of usually Danish-Greenlandic bilingual Inuit people in Greenland. It is closely related to the Inuit languages in Canada_
Greenlandic is a polysynthetic language that allows the creation of long words by stringing together roots and suffixes. Both nouns and verbs have complex derivational morphology_

Le groenlandais (kalaallisut) est une langue eskimo-aléoute parlée par un petit groupe de personnes inuites, en général bilingues danois-groenlandais, au Groenland. Il est très proche des langues inuites au Canada_

Le groenlandais est une langue polysynthétique qui permet la création de longs mots en enchaînant les racines et les suffixes. Les noms et les verbes ont également une morphologie dérivationnelle complexe_
Georgian (Kartuli) is the most widely spoken of the Caucasian languages. It is the official language of Georgia_
Georgian is written in its own unique writing system, the Georgian script_
Georgian is the literary language for all regional subgroups of Georgians, including those who speak other Kartvelian languages_
Le géorgien (kartuli) est la plus parlée des langues caucasiennes. C’est la langue officielle de la Géorgie_
Le géorgien a son propre système d’écriture unique, l’alphabet géorgien_
Le géorgien est la langue littéraire pour tous les sous-groupes régionaux de Géorgiens, y compris ceux qui parlent d’autres langues kartvéliennes_

Kazakh is a Turkic language belonging to the Kipchak (or North-Western Turkic) branch. Kazakh is primarily a Central Asian language and is spoken in Europe in the region between the lower Volga and the frontier of Kazakhstan_
Today, Kazakh is written in Cyrillic in Kazakhstan and Mongolia, while the Kazakh-speakers in China use an Arabic-derived alphabet similar to that used to write Uyghur_
Le kazakh est une langue appartenant à la famille des langues turques. Il est parlé en Asie centrale, principalement au Kazakhstan, où il est la langue nationale, et au Xinjiang_

Le kazakh est écrit de différentes manières: en utilisant une variante de l’alphabet latin proche de celle utilisée en turc, l’alphabet arabe modifié (en Chine, en Iran, dans une petite partie de la Mongolie, en Afghanistan) et le cyrillique agrémenté de 9 lettres supplémentaires, qui est l’écriture officielle au Kazakhstan_
Le kazakh est particulièrement proche du kirghiz_

source.description: Selangor Sign Language is a sign language used in Malaysia. Sign languages are languages which mainly use signs made with the hands, the arms or the body and facial expressions_

description.p: Khmer, or Cambodian, is the second most widely spoken Austroasiatic language (after Vietnamese). It is the language of the Khmer people and the official language of Cambodia_
Khmer is primarily an analytic, isolating language which is not tonal_
The Khmer language is written with an abugida ‘Khmer script’_

Le khmer est une langue appartenant au groupe des langues môn-khmères de la famille des langues austro-asiatiques. Langue des populations khmères, il est principalement parlé au Cambodge et dans les régions limitrophes de Thaïlande par les Khmers Surin (du Nord) et au Viêt Nam par les Khmers Krom, ce qui s’explique par l’histoire de ces pays_
C’est une langue non tonale, contrairement au vietnamien, l’autre grande langue môn-khmère_
Le système d’écriture du khmer est alphasyllabique_

source.description: Kinyarwanda is a Bantu language. It is one of the official languages of Rwanda_

description.p: Kyrgyz is a Turkic language spoken in Kyrgyzstan as well as China, Afghanistan, Kazakhstan, Tajikistan, Turkey, Uzbekistan, Pakistan and Russia. Kyrgyz is a member of the Kyrgyz–Kipchak subgroup of the Kypchak languages, and modern-day language convergence has resulted in a mutual intelligibility between Kyrgyz and Kazakh_

In 1940 a Cyrillic alphabet eventually became common and has remained so to this day, though some Kyrgyz still use the Arabic alphabet. There was a popular idea among some Kyrgyz people to make a transition to the Latin alphabet, but the plan has not been implemented yet_

Le kirghiz ou kirghize est une langue appartenant au groupe des langues turques de la famille des langues altaïques. Il est parlé en Asie centrale, principalement au Kirghizstan (où il est la langue nationale), au Tadjikistan, au Xinjiang et en Afghanistan_

On l’écrit au moyen de l’alphabet cyrillique, auquel trois lettres sont ajoutées, mais le kirghiz est parfois écrit en utilisant l’alphabet arabe, lui aussi complété. Le kirghiz est très proche du kazakh. Il est habituellement classé avec celui-ci ainsi que le tatar et le karakalpak au sein du groupe des langues kiptchak (ou branche turque occidentale)_

source.description: Northern Kurdish (Kurmanji) is a group of Kurdish dialects predominantly spoken in southeast Turkey, northwest Iran, northern Iraq and northern Syria. This group uses the Latin script_
Kikongo is a Bantu language_

description.p: Korean is the official language of South Korea and North Korea. For over a millennium, Korean was written with adapted Chinese characters called hanja, complemented by phonetic systems like hyangchal, gugyeol, and idu. In the 15th century, a national writing system called hangul was commissioned by Sejong the Great, but it only came into widespread use in the 20th century_
Most historical linguists classify Korean as a isolate language with no known relationship to any other languages_

Le coréen est une langue utilisée en Corée du Nord et en Corée du Sud. La classification du coréen est encore controversée. La plupart des linguistes le considèrent comme un isolat, tandis que d’autres le regroupent dans une hypothétique famille altaïque_
L’alphabet qui sert à écrire le coréen est le hangeul; les hanja (sinogrammes employés dans cette langue) sont également utilisés, une assez grande partie du lexique étant d’origine chinoise_

source.description: Kurdish is a member of the Iranian subgroup of the Indo-European languages, spoken by the Kurdish people in Iran, Iraq, Turkey and Syria. The term ‘Kurdish languages’ is also used instead of ‘Kurdish language’ because the dialects are not mutually intelligible without acquired bilingualism and the languages spoken by Kurds do not form a linguistic group. The principal Northern dialect, Kurmanjo is written in the Latin alphabet while others use the Arabic script_

description.p: Le kurde est une langue appartenant au sous-groupe iranien des langues indo-européennes, parlée par le peuple kurde en Iran, en Iraq, en Turquie et en Syrie. Le terme «langues kurdes» est également utilisé à la place de «langue kurde», parce que les dialectes ne sont pas mutuellement intelligibles sans bilinguisme acquis et les langues parlées par les Kurdes ne forment pas un groupe linguistique_
Le principal dialecte du Nord, Kurmanjo, est écrit avec l’alphabet latin, tandis que d’autres utilisent l’alphabet arabe_

source.description: Korean Sign Language is a sign language used in South Korea. Sign languages are languages which mainly use signs made with the hands, the arms or the body and facial expressions_
Brunei Malay is a Malayo-Polynesian language. It is the national language of Brunei and a lingua franca in parts of East Malaysia_

description.p: Lao or Laotian is a tonal language of the Tai–Kadai language family. It is the official language of Laos, and also spoken in the north-east of Thailand_
Lao, like many languages in Laos, is written in the Lao script, which is an abugida script_
Although there is no official standard, the Vientiane dialect has become the de facto standard_

Le lao ou laotien est une langue du groupe taï de la branche dite «kam-taï» de la famille des langues taï-kadaï. C’est la langue officielle du Laos. La langue lao peut être divisée en cinq dialectes différents selon la région. Le lao de Vientiane est en général bien compris dans tout le pays_
L’alphabet laotien est basé sur l’alphabet siamois ancien, comme pour l’alphabet thaï_
Latin is an extinct Indo-European language which was spoken in the ancient city of Rome and its empire. Modern Romance languages are continuations of dialectal forms (vulgar Latin) of the language_

Additionally many students, scholars, and some members of the Christian clergy speak it fluently, and it is still taught in some educational institutions around the world. Latin is still used in the creation of new words in modern languages of many different families, and largely in biological taxonomy_

Le latin est une langue indo-européenne, souvent considérée comme une langue morte, qui a été parlée dans la Rome antique et son empire. Les langues romanes modernes sont des continuations des formes dialectales (latin vulgaire) de la langue_

De nombreux étudiants, des chercheurs et des membres du clergé chrétien parlent encore couramment le latin, et il est toujours enseigné dans certains établissements d’enseignement à travers le monde. Le latin est encore utilisé dans la création de nouveaux mots dans les langues modernes de nombreuses familles, en particulier dans la taxonomie biologique_
Latvian is one of the two living members of the Baltic languages, the other being Lithuanian. It is the official language of Latvia_
Latvian is more innovative, especially in morphology than Lithuanian_
Le letton ou lette est l’un des deux membres vivants des langues baltes, l’autre étant le lituanien. C’est la langue officielle de la Lettonie_
Le letton est plus novateur, en particulier dans la morphologie, que le lituanien_

source.description: Libyan Sign Language is a sign language used in Libya. Sign languages are languages which mainly use signs made with the hands, the arms or the body and facial expressions_
Leco is an indigenous language isolate. It is one of the official languages of Bolivia_
Lingala is a Bantu language_

description.p: Lithuanian is one of the two living members of the Baltic languages, the other being Latvian. It is the official language of Lithuania_
The Lithuanian language is often said to be the most conservative living Indo-European language, retaining many features of Proto-Indo-European now lost in other Indo-European languages_
Le lituanien est l’un des deux membres vivants des langues baltes, l’autre étant le letton. C’est la langue officielle de la Lituanie_

Le lituanien est souvent dit la langue indo-européenne vivante la plus conservatrice, gardant de nombreuses caractéristiques de l’indo-européen aujourd’hui perdues dans d’autres langues indo-européennes_

source.description: Lithuanian Sign Language is a sign language used in Lithunia. Sign languages are languages which mainly use signs made with the hands, the arms or the body and facial expressions_
Lyons Sign Language is a sign language used in Lyon region in France. Sign languages are languages which mainly use signs made with the hands, the arms or the body and facial expressions_
Latvian Sign Language is a sign language used in Latvia. Sign languages are languages which mainly use signs made with the hands, the arms or the body and facial expressions_
Laos Sign Language is a sign language used in Laos. Sign languages are languages which mainly use signs made with the hands, the arms or the body and facial expressions_
Panamanian Sign Language is a sign language used in Panama. Sign languages are languages which mainly use signs made with the hands, the arms or the body and facial expressions_
Trinidad and Tobago Sign Language is a sign language used in Trinidad and Tobago. Sign languages are languages which mainly use signs made with the hands, the arms or the body and facial expressions_
Luxembourgish is a Germanic language which belongs to the West Moselle Franconian subgroup of German dialects. Luxembourgish is spoken mainly in the Grand Duchy of Luxembourg_
Le luxembourgeois est une langue germanique qui appartient au sous-groupe du moyen francique de dialectes allemands. Le luxembourgeois est parlé principalement dans le Grand-Duché de Luxembourg_
Luba-Lulua is a Bantu language_
Marshallese is a Malayo-Polynesian language. It is one of the official languages of the Marshall Islands_
Maltese Sign Language is a sign language used in Malta. Sign languages are languages which mainly use signs made with the hands, the arms or the body and facial expressions_
Mexican Sign Language is a sign language used in Mexico. Sign languages are languages which mainly use signs made with the hands, the arms or the body and facial expressions_

description.p: Minangkabau is an Austronesian language spoken by the Minangkabau of West Sumatra. The language is also a lingua franca along the western coastal region of the province of North Sumatra, and is even used in parts of Aceh, where the language is called Aneuk Jamee. It is also spoken in some parts of Malaysia_
There are great grammatical similarities between the Minangkabau language and Malay_
Le minangkabau est une langue austronésienne parlée en Indonésie, dans le nord de l’île de Sumatra_
Il fait partie des langues malaïques qui représentent un des sous-groupes du malayo-polynésien occidental_

source.description: Languages without code_
Langues sans codes

description.p: Macedonian is a member of the southern subgroup of the Slavic languages, spoken principally in the Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia_
The name of the Macedonian language is a matter of political controversy in Greece as is its distinctiveness compared to Bulgarian in Bulgaria_
Le macédonien est une langue appartenant au sous-groupe méridional des langues slaves, parlée principalement dans l’ancienne République yougoslave de Macédoine_
Le nom de la langue macédonienne est un sujet de controverse politique en Grèce, ainsi que sa particularité par rapport au bulgare en Bulgarie_

source.description: Malagasy is an Austronesian language and the national language of Madagascar. Most people in Madagascar speak it as a first language as do some people of Malagasy descent elsewhere. The Malagasy language is the westernmost member of the Malayo-Polynesian branch of the Austronesian language family. It is related to the Malayo-Polynesian languages of Indonesia, Malaysia, and the Philippines, and more closely to the East Barito languages spoken in Borneo_

Le malgache ou malagasy est la langue nationale de Madagascar. C’est depuis toujours une langue normalisée, principalement dérivée du dialecte parlé sur les hauts plateaux centraux. Elle est la plus occidentale des langues malayo-polynésiennes et donc des langues austronésiennes. Plus précisément, elle appartient au rameau dit «Grand Barito». Dans cette région, la langue dominante est aujourd’hui le malais, qui appartient à un autre rameau malayo-polynésien. Le malgache est également utilisé à Mayotte sous le nom de «kibushi» ou «bushi»_

description.p: Maltese is a Semitic language, historically a dialect of Arabic, spoken in Malta. About half of the vocabulary is derived from standard Italian and Sicilian; English words also make up an important part of the Maltese vocabulary_
It is the only Semitic language written in the Latin script in its standard form_

Le maltais est une langue sémitique, historiquement un dialecte de l’arabe, parlé à Malte. Environ la moitié du vocabulaire est dérivé de l’italien standard et de Sicile; les mots anglais constituent également une partie importante du vocabulaire maltais_
Il est la seule langue sémitique écrite en alphabet latin dans sa forme standard_

source.description: Mandinka (Mandingo) is a Mande language spoken by the Mandinka people in Senegal, the Gambia and Guinea-Bissau. Mandinka is written by Latin or Arabic scripts_

description.p: The Mongolian language is the best-known member of the Mongolic language family_
In Mongolia, the Khalkha dialect, written in Cyrillic, is predominant, while in Inner Mongolia, the language is dialectally more diverse and is written in the traditional Mongolian script_

Le mongol est une langue appartenant au groupe des langues mongoles. Il est parlé en Mongolie et en Chine (notamment en Mongolie-Intérieure), ainsi qu’en Russie (notamment en Bouriatie et en Kalmoukie)_

Le mongol est un ensemble de langues et de dialectes qui utilisent de nombreuses formes d’écritures. Différentes écritures ont été créées spécifiquement pour cette langue, mais d’autres ont également été utilisées pour retranscrire les langues mongoles, telles que les caractères chinois han, l’alphabet latin et l’alphabet cyrillique légèrement modifié_

source.description: Machinere is an Arawakan indigenous language. It is one of the official languages of Bolivia_

Martha's Vineyard Sign Language is a sign language used on the island of Martha's Vineyard, in the United States. Sign languages are languages which mainly use signs made with the hands, the arms or the body and facial expressions_

label.lg_version: lingua dei segni di Martha's Vineyard

source.description: Māori is a Malayo-Polynesian language. It is one of the official languages of New Zealand_

Yucatec Maya Sign Language is a sign language used in the Yucatan region, in Mexico, by Maya communities. Sign languages are languages which mainly use signs made with the hands, the arms or the body and facial expressions_
Mongolian Sign Language is a sign language used in Mongolia. Sign languages are languages which mainly use signs made with the hands, the arms or the body and facial expressions_
Wichí Lhamtés Nocten is a Matacoan indigenous language. It is one of the official languages of Bolivia_
More than one language_
Plus d’une langue
Burmese is a Sino-Tibetan language. It is the official language of Myanmar. The Burmese alphabet is a Brahmic script, an abugida writing system_
Madagascar Sign Language is a sign language used in Madagascar. Sign languages are languages which mainly use signs made with the hands, the arms or the body and facial expressions_

Monastic Sign Language is a sign language used by Christian monks, mainly in Europe. Sign languages are languages which mainly use signs made with the hands, the arms or the body and facial expressions_
Movima is an indigenous language isolate. It is one of the official languages of Bolivia_
Mozambican Sign Language is a sign language used in Mozambique. Sign languages are languages which mainly use signs made with the hands, the arms or the body and facial expressions_
Nauruan is a Malayo-Polynesian language. It is one of the official languages of Nauru_
Southern Ndebele is a Bantu language. It is one of the official languages of South Africa_
Namibian Sign Language is a sign language used in Namibia. Sign languages are languages which mainly use signs made with the hands, the arms or the body and facial expressions_
Nicaraguan Sign Language is a sign language used in Nicaragua. Sign languages are languages which mainly use signs made with the hands, the arms or the body and facial expressions_

description.p: Nepali or Nepalese is an Indo-Aryan language. It is the official language and de facto lingua franca of Nepal and is also spoken in India, Bhutan, Myanmar, Hong Kong and United Kingdom. Nepali developed in proximity to a number of Indo-Aryan languages, most notably Pahari and Magahi, and shows Sanskrit influences. Nepali language shares important lexical similarity with the Bengali language_
The language is written by devanagari_

Le népalais est une langue de la famille indo-iranienne, parlée au Népal, en Inde et au Bhoutan. C’est la plus orientale des langues pahari, un groupe de langues et de dialectes parlés au pied de l’Himalaya depuis l’est du Népal jusqu’aux États indiens de l’Uttaranchal et de l’Himachal Pradesh_
Le népalais s’écrit en devanagari_

source.description: Niuean is a Malayo-Polynesian language. It is one of the official languages of Niue_

Dutch is a West Germanic language whose closest relative is German. It is spoken in the Netherlands, by about 60% of the population of Belgium, in Suriname and in the Caribbean island nations of Aruba, Curaçao, and Sint Maarten. The version of Dutch spoken in Southern Africa has been standardised into Afrikaans_

Le néerlandais est une langue germanique occidentale, dont le plus proche parent est l’allemand. Elle est parlée aux Pays-Bas, en Belgique (par environ 60 % de la population), au Suriname et dans les pays insulaires des Caraïbes (Aruba, Curaçao et Sint-Maarten). La version du néerlandais parlé en Afrique du Sud a été normalisée comme l’afrikaans_

comment.lg_version: Documentation for ISO 639 identifier "NNO": This individual language is member of a macrolanguage : Norwegian (nor)

source.description: Nynorsk is an official written standard for the Norwegian language_

comment.lg_version: Documentation for ISO 639 identifier "NOB": This individual language is member of a macrolanguage : Norwegian (nor)

source.description: Bokmål is an official written standard for the Norwegian language_

description.p: Norwegian belongs to the Northern branch of Germanic languages. It is spoken primarily in Norway. Together with Swedish and Danish, Norwegian forms a continuum of more or less mutually intelligible local and regional variants_
There are two official forms of written Norwegian: Bokmål (literally ‘book tongue’) and Nynorsk (literally ‘new Norwegian’)_

Le norvégien appartient à la branche nord des langues germaniques. Il est parlé principalement en Norvège. Avec le suédois et le danois, le norvégien forme un continuum de variantes locales et régionales plus ou moins mutuellement intelligibles_
Il existe deux formes officielles du norvégien écrit: le bokmål (littéralement «langue du livre») et le nynorsk (littéralement «nouveau norvégien»)_

source.description: Nigerian Sign Language is a sign language used in Nigeria. Sign languages are languages which mainly use signs made with the hands, the arms or the body and facial expressions_
Norwegian Sign Language is a sign language used in Norway. Sign languages are languages which mainly use signs made with the hands, the arms or the body and facial expressions_
Northern Sotho is a Bantu language. It is one of the official languages of South Africa_
Nepalese Sign Language is a sign language used in Nepal. Sign languages are languages which mainly use signs made with the hands, the arms or the body and facial expressions_
Maritime Sign Language is a sign language used in Canada's Atlantic provinces. Sign languages are languages which mainly use signs made with the hands, the arms or the body and facial expressions_
Chewa is a Bantu language. It is one of the official languages of Malawi and Zimbabwe_
New Zealand Sign Language is a sign language used in New Zealand. Sign languages are languages which mainly use signs made with the hands, the arms or the body and facial expressions_

Occitan is the generic name for Romance idioms which are native mainly to southern France. There are polemics about the unity of the language, as some think that Occitan is a macrolanguage. There is no single written standard language called ‘Occitan’, and Occitan has no official status in France, home to most of Occitania_

L’occitan est le nom générique pour les idiomes romans originaires principalement du sud de la France. Il y a polémique sur l’unité de la langue, certains pensant que l’occitan est une macrolangue. Il n’y a pas de langue écrite standard intitulée «occitan», et l’occitan n’a pas de statut officiel en France, qui abrite la majeure partie de l’Occitanie_

description.p: Ossetic or Ossetian is a member of the Iranian subgroup of the Indo-European languages. It is spoken in Ossetia, a region on the northern Caucasus_
Written Ossetian may be immediately recognised by its use of the Cyrillic letter Ae (Ӕ ӕ), a letter to be found in no other language using Cyrillic script_
L’ossète est une langue appartenant au sous-groupe iranien de la famille des langues indo-européennes. Il est parlé en Ossétie, région située dans le Caucase septentrional_
L’ossète écrit peut être immédiatement reconnu grâce à son utilisation de la lettre cyrillique Ae (Ӕ ӕ), lettre que l’on ne trouve dans aucune autre langue utilisant l’alphabet cyrillique_

source.description: Papiamento is a Portugal-based creol language. It is one of the official languages of Aruba and Curaçao_
Palauan is a Malayo-Polynesian language. It is one of the official languages of Palau_
Pacahuara is a Panoan indigenous language. It is one of the official languages of Bolivia_
Pitcairn-Norfolk is an English-based creole language. It is one of the official languages of Pitcairn Island and Norfolk Island_
Pakistan Sign Language is a sign language used in Pakistan. Sign languages are languages which mainly use signs made with the hands, the arms or the body and facial expressions_

description.p: Polish is the eastern member of the Lechitic branch of the West Slavic languages. It is spoken primarily in Poland_
Polish is the second most widely spoken Slavic language, after Russian_

source.description: Le polonais fait partie de la branche léchitique des langues slaves de l’Ouest. Il est parlé principalement en Pologne. Le polonais est la deuxième langue slave la plus utilisée après le russe_

description.p: Portuguese is a member of the Ibero-Romance subgroup of the Romance languages. It is spoken in Portugal, Brazil, Mozambique, Angola, Cape Verde, Guinea-Bissau, São Tomé and Príncipe, Macau (China), Equatorial Guinea and East Timor_
Portuguese is the major language of the southern hemisphere_

Le portugais est une langue appartenant au sous-groupe ibéro-roman des langues romanes. Il est parlé au Portugal, au Brésil, au Mozambique, en Angola, au Cap-Vert, en Guinée-Bissau, à Sao Tomé-et-Principe, à Macao (Chine), en Guinée équatoriale et au Timor-Oriental_
Le portugais est la langue la plus parlée de l’hémisphère Sud_

source.description: Peruvian Sign Language is a sign language used in Peru. Sign languages are languages which mainly use signs made with the hands, the arms or the body and facial expressions_
Dari is an Indo-European language, the variety of the Persian language spoken in Afghanistan. It is written using a modified variant of the Arabic alphabet_

Providencia Sign Language is a village sign language of Providence Island in the Western Caribbean. Sign languages are languages which mainly use signs made with the hands, the arms or the body and facial expressions_
Persian Sign Language is a sign language used in Iran. Sign languages are languages which mainly use signs made with the hands, the arms or the body and facial expressions_

Plains Indian Sign Language is a trade language (or international auxiliary language) that was once the lingua franca across central Canada, central and western United States and northern Mexico, used among the various Plains Nations. Sign languages are languages which mainly use signs made with the hands, the arms or the body and facial expressions_

label.lg_version: znakové jazyky indiánů z Velkých plání
langue des signes des Indiens des Plaines
língua gestual dos Índios das Planícies

source.description: Penang Sign Language is a sign language used in Malaysia. Sign languages are languages which mainly use signs made with the hands, the arms or the body and facial expressions_
Puerto Rican Sign Language is a sign language used in Puerto Rico. Sign languages are languages which mainly use signs made with the hands, the arms or the body and facial expressions_
Pauserna is a Tupian indigenous language. It is one of the official languages of Bolivia_
Polish Sign Language is a sign language used in Poland. Sign languages are languages which mainly use signs made with the hands, the arms or the body and facial expressions_
Philippine Sign Language is a sign language used in the Philippines. Sign languages are languages which mainly use signs made with the hands, the arms or the body and facial expressions_
Portuguese Sign Language is a sign language used in Portugal. Sign languages are languages which mainly use signs made with the hands, the arms or the body and facial expressions_
Puquina is an indigenous language isolate. It is one of the official languages of Bolivia_

description.p: Pashto, also known historically as Afghani and Pathani, is the native language of the Pashtun people of south-central Asia. Pashto is a member of the Eastern Iranian languages group_
Pashto employs the Pashto alphabet, a modified form of the Persian alphabet, which in part is derived from the Arabic alphabet. It has extra letters for Pashto-specific sounds_
Le pachto est une langue appartenant au groupe indo-iranien de la famille des langues indo-européennes. Les locuteurs du pachto sont les Pachtounes_
Cette langue s’écrit au moyen d’un alphabet arabe modifié_
Le pachto est composé de deux dialectes principaux, celui de Kandahar et celui de Paktiyâ (ou de Peshawar)_

source.description: Quechua or Southern Quechua is a Quachuan indigenous language. It is one of the official languages of Bolivia and Peru_

original_name.lg_version: Santa Ana de Tusi Pasco Quechua

label.lg_version: santa Ana de Tusi Pasco Quechua

source.description: Rarotongan is a Malayo-Polynesian language. It is one of the official languages of the Cook Islands_
Reyesano is a Tacanan indigenous language. It is one of the official languages of Bolivia_

Documentation for ISO 639 identifier "RMF": This individual language is member of a macrolanguage : Romani (ROM)
Documentation for ISO 639 identifier "RML": This individual language is member of a macrolanguage : Romani (ROM)
